Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin and the Christ child ride on a donkey accompanied by Joseph who holds a flaming torch, a shepherd's encampment with a large fire at right, the moon is low in the sky and is reflected in a pool of water at left; a night-scene with the figures illuminated and highlighted by various light sources; after Adam Elsheimer. 1613 Engraving
Curator's comments: For another impression see also F,3.92. After the painting by Elsheimer in the Alte Pinakothek, Munich, inv.no.216. Lit.: K. Andrews, 'Adam Elsheimer:Paintings-Drawings-Prints', London, 1977, cat.no.26; C. Ackley, 'Printmaking in the Age of Rembrandt', ex.cat. Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, 1981, cat.no.44; R. Klessmann, 'Adam Elsheimer 1578-1610', exhibition catalogue, London, 2006, cat.nos.36 and 55.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (3)
Exhibition history: 1986 Oct-Nov, Bristol, Bristol Museum and Art Gallery, Night Prints 1986 Nov-Dec, Durham, DLI Museum, Night Prints 1987 Jan-Feb, Sheffield, Sheffield Art Gallery, Night Prints 2011 March-June, Tokyo, NM Western Art, Rembrandt: Dark Tonalities 2011 June-Sep, Nagoya City Art Museum, Rembrandt: Dark Tonalities
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
